meanings.definition: The act of canceling or annulling something.
meanings.sent1: The cancellation of the party disappointed many guests.
meanings.sent2: I requested a cancellation of my subscription to the magazine.
meanings.sent3: The cancellation of the picnic due to rain left everyone feeling gloomy.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to end the project was a cancellation of all our hard work.
meanings.sent5: The sudden cancellation of the flight caused chaos at the airport.

meanings.definition: The process of invalidating a reservation or appointment.
meanings.sent1: The hotel's cancellation policy allowed guests to change their plans.
meanings.sent2: I had to make a cancellation for my dentist appointment due to a sudden meeting.
meanings.sent3: The cancellation of the dinner reservation led to a spontaneous picnic in the park.
meanings.sent4: His unexpected cancellation of the meeting left everyone confused.
meanings.sent5: The cancellation of the event left many disappointed attendees.

meanings.definition: The removal of a debt or financial obligation.
meanings.sent1: The cancellation of the loan relieved her of a huge burden.
meanings.sent2: The company's cancellation of the outstanding balance surprised many investors.
meanings.sent3: His cancellation of the debt felt like a weight lifted off his shoulders.
meanings.sent4: The cancellation of the mortgage was a huge relief for the family.
meanings.sent5: The sudden cancellation of the debt brought unexpected joy to their lives.
